intro: Senecio leucanthemifolius var. cyrenaicus, commonly known as the Cyrenaic Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and grayish-green in color. It produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in summer. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
